citation.article-title: Thermovenabulum ferriorganovorum gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel thermophilic, anaerobic, endospore-forming bacterium.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Thermovenabulum (Ther.mo.ve.na'bul.um. Gr. adj. thermos hot; L. neut. n. venabulum a hunting spear; N.L. neut. n. Thermovenabulum hot, hunting spear-shaped cell, referring to the branched cell morphology)
Form branched cells and protrusions of cell envelope.
Grow organotrophically on a number of fermentable substrates.
Reduce Fe(III), Mn(IV), nitrate, sulfite, thiosulfate, elemental sulfur and fumarate.
The type species is Thermovenabulum ferriorganovorum.
